meanings.definition: Relating to or resembling a ganglion.
meanings.sent1: The gangliar nerve endings in the body help transmit signals.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the gangliar structure of the nervous system.
meanings.sent3: The gangliar pattern on the fabric looked like tiny interconnected circles.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts formed a gangliar network, connecting various ideas together.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a gangliar design, showcasing the intricate connections.

meanings.sent1: The gangliar cells in the brain play a crucial role in processing information.
meanings.sent2: The scientist conducted research on gangliar tissues to understand their function.
meanings.sent3: The gangliar clusters in the garden resembled tiny colorful beads.
meanings.sent4: His mind felt like a gangliar network, each thought branching out in different directions.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with a gangliar palette of colors, creating a beautiful scene.

meanings.sent1: The gangliar structure of the nervous system is complex yet efficient.
meanings.sent2: The patient's condition required surgery to address the gangliar abnormalities.
meanings.sent3: The gangliar arrangement of lights in the park created a mesmerizing display.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace was a gangliar chain of pearls, each one unique and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The garden was a gangliar paradise of flowers, each bloom adding to the beauty of the whole.
